spock.util.concurrent
[Groovy] Class BlockingVariables

java.lang.Object
  spock.util.concurrent.BlockingVariables

@ThreadSafe
class BlockingVariables

Provides an unlimited number of dynamic variables. Reading the value of a variable will block until some other thread has set the value of the variable, or a timeout expires. Useful for verifying state in an expect- or then-block that has been captured in some other thread.

Example: 

 // create object under specification
 def machine = new Machine()

 BlockingVariables vars = new BlockingVariables()

 // register async callback
 machine.workDone << { result ->
  vars.result = result
 }

 when:
 machine.start()

 then:
 // blocks until workDone callback has set result, or a timeout expires
 vars.result == WorkResult.OK

 cleanup:
 // shut down all threads
 machine?.shutdown()
Authors:
Peter Niederwieser

Same as BlockingVariables(1, TimeUnit.SECONDS).
BlockingVariables(double timeout)

Instantiates a BlockingVariable with the specified timeout (in seconds).

Instantiates a BlockingVariables instance with the specified timeout.

BlockingVariables()
Same as BlockingVariables(1, TimeUnit.SECONDS).

BlockingVariables

BlockingVariables(double timeout)
Instantiates a BlockingVariable with the specified timeout (in seconds).
Parameters:
timeout - the timeout (in seconds) for reading a variable's value.

BlockingVariables

@Deprecated
BlockingVariables(int timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
Instantiates a BlockingVariables instance with the specified timeout.
deprecated:
use BlockingVariables(double) instead
Parameters:
timeout - timeout for reading a variable's value
unit - the timeout's time unit

 
Method Detail

getProperty

java.lang.Object getProperty(java.lang.String name)
Gets a variable's value. Blocks until a value has been set for the variable or a timeout expires. This method should not be called directly but by getting a dynamic variable's value.
Parameters:
name - the variable's name
Returns:
the variable's value

setProperty

void setProperty(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Object value)
Sets a variable's value. This method should not be called directly but by setting a dynamic variable's value.
Parameters:
name - the variable's name
value - the variable's value
